intro: Capsella mediterranea, commonly known as the Mediterranean catchfly, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its seeds are enclosed in a pappus-equipped capsule, aiding in wind dispersal. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
